name: Ginger Pork - Pork Shogayaki
recipeInstruction: grate ginger with a grater and slice onion
add soy sauce, mirin, rice wine, and sugar and stir to incorporate
cover with lid and cook for 3-5 minutes
remove cover and reduce liquid by 50%
pour contents over rice and serve

name: COCA COLA CHICKEN WING
recipeInstruction: Wash the chicken wings with water. Cut two knives on the back of the chicken wings. Cut a piece of ginger into silks
Add the chicken wings, 2 pieces of ginger and enough water in a pan and cook it until boiling. Continue to cook it for 2 minutes. Pour off the hot water, wash and drain the chicken wings
Heat a pan with oil, fry the chicken wings until fragrant. Turn it over and continue to fry it until fragrant
Sprinkle ginger silks and 2 tablespoons beer in the pan and cook it until the beer has thickened. Add 1 tablespoon light soy sauce and 1/2 tablespoon dark soy sauce in the pan
Stir-fry the chicken wings a few times. Pour the coca-cola in the pan and cook it until boiling
Cover the lid. Continue to cook it under middle heat until the sauce has reduced a half. Add salt and cook it under high heat until the sauce has thickened
Transfer the chicken on a plate and sprinkle cooked white sesame seeds and serve

name: Korean Beef Bulgogi
recipeIngredient: 1/2 small pear, peeled and coarsely grated
recipeInstruction: Wrap steak in plastic wrap, and place in the freezer for 30 minutes. Unwrap and slice across the grain into 1/4-inch thick slices

In a medium bowl, combine pear, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger and gochujang. In a gallon size Ziploc bag, combine soy sauce mixture and steak; marinate for at least 2 hours to overnight, turning the bag occasionally

Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a cast iron grill pan over medium-high heat. * Working in batches, add steak to the grill pan in a single layer and cook, flipping once, until charred and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side. Repeat with remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and steak
Serve immediately, garnished with green onions and sesame seeds, if desired
